total_subquestions_ys: Q1: Identify the unique colors in the grid.
Q2: For each color, find the top left and bottom right coordinates of the rectangle that encloses all cells of that color.
Q3: For each color, check if the cells within the rectangle from Q2 are all of that color and there are no other cells of that color outside the rectangle.
Q4: For each color that meets the criteria from Q3, create a new grid with the size of the rectangle and fill it with the color.
Q5: Arrange the grids from Q4 in the order of the top left coordinates of their rectangles in the original grid, from top to bottom and left to right.
Q1: Identify the unique colors in the grid.
Q2: For each color, identify the top left corner of the smallest rectangle that can contain all cells of that color.
Q3: For each color, identify the bottom right corner of the smallest rectangle that can contain all cells of that color.
Q4: For each color, create a new grid that only contains the cells within the rectangle identified in Q2 and Q3.
Q5: Arrange the new grids created in Q4 from top to bottom in the order of the color's first appearance from top to bottom in the original grid.
